skillTree.name: Fuelled by Blood
skillTree.description: Even when not feasting, the Beastmen taste blood on their lips, smell it on their fur, and want for more.

skillTree.name: Voice of the Dark Gods
skillTree.description: This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice – a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.

skillTree.name: Uncanny Senses
skillTree.description: He knows. Nobody knows how, but he does. He has always just known.

skillTree.name: Shadow Hide
skillTree.description: Chaos smiles upon them, granting unnatural and heretical defence against mortal machinations.

skillTree.name: Something Wicked This Way Comes
skillTree.description: Malagor's very presence strikes fear into the heart of men - they tremble at the sight of the Crowfather approaching.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Something Wicked This Way Comes Upgraded"

unit_ability.description: Something Wicked This Way Comes Upgraded

skillTree.name: Unholy Power
skillTree.description: Gifted by the Chaos Gods themselves, Malagor distributes this gift to his followers, that his masters may see their agenda realised.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10

skillTree.name: Crowfather
skillTree.description: "Into the mud with them, break their skulls and eat their hearts!"

skillTree.name: Portents of Doom
skillTree.description: "He is the devil rendered in woodcut in ancient tomes kept under lock and key, lest the terrible secrets within blast the sanity of any who read them."

skillTree.name: Nightmarish Cabal
skillTree.description: Malagor's profanities are so great that no other Bray-Shaman would dare enact them. Despite this, the foolish and insane attempt a fraction of his works.

effects.description:
Hero action cost: -25% for Bray-Shamans
	(all characters)

Hero action success chance: +10% for Bray-Shamans
	(all characters)

skillTree.name: Mantle of Crows
skillTree.description: The Dark Omen twists the Winds to both savage his enemies and empower his hordes.

ui_effects.description: Strong vs 120 men unit or above

skillTree.name: Dreads & Charms
skillTree.description: Impenetrably matted fur and grim trinkets make the Bray-Shamans more than just vile to behold, but incredibly hard to injure.

skillTree.name: Hardened Pelts
skillTree.description: By the Bray-Shaman’s incantations, those lesser in body or mind have their hair and fur clogged into impervious hides.

effects.description:
Armour: +15 for Chaos Warhounds, Harpies, Razorgor Herd, Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, Ghorgon, Cygor, and Manticore units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.name: Dual Wielder
skillTree.description: In the right hands the braystaff is not just a symbol of position or conduit of magic, but also a brutal weapon.

skillTree.name: Bellows of the Discordant
skillTree.description: In frenzied ritual celebration the Bray-Shaman invokes the Dark Gods’ power to infuse the herds with bestial strength.

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +15% for Chaos Warhounds, Harpies, Razorgor Herd, Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, Ghorgon, Cygor, and Manticore units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.name: Flock of Doom
skillTree.description: With a mighty bellow, the caster invokes Corvus the Crow Lord, summoning his servants to peck at the foe's eyes.

ui_effects.description: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flock of Doom"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Flock of Doom Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Flock of Doom Upgraded"

skillTree.name: The Enfeebling Foe
skillTree.description: When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.name: The Penumbral Pendulum
skillTree.description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Doom & Darkness"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Doom & Darkness Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Doom & Darkness Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Mantle of Ghorok
skillTree.description: Ghorok was a legendary Minotaur, ferocious as a storm. His spirit-mantle is terrible and dangerous to the bearer.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Mantle of Ghorok Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Mantle of Ghorok"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Mantle of Ghorok Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Savage Dominion
skillTree.description: The Bray-Shaman sends his mind into the wilds, possessing the largest creature he can find and storming back with a vengeance.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -5 for "Savage Dominion"

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.name: Bestial Surge
skillTree.description: The Bray-Shaman inflames the uncontrollable urge to rend the foe limb from limb, causing the roaring, bellowing mass to surge forward.

skillTree.name: Wild Heart
skillTree.description: The spellcaster attunes the magic of the wild, channelling its ancient and arcane power.

skillTree.name: Smoke & Mirrors
skillTree.description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.

skillTree.name: Doom of Mankind
skillTree.description: To many, the vilified Crowfather is a harbinger of the downfall of all they hold dear.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells

skillTree.name: Presence of Morrslieb
skillTree.description: The great green orb hangs ominously in the sky above, its followers driven to acts of madness and depravity.

skillTree.name: Fury of the Herd
skillTree.description: A summons to war in which all are drawn into the cacophonous charge; glory or sanguine death is the prize.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, and Bestigor Herd units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +4 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, and Bestigor Herd units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, and Bestigor Herd units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, and Bestigor Herd units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, and Bestigor Herd units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Leader of the Raucous Host
skillTree.description: At the head of the warherd, he whips his followers into a frothing furore, then unleashes them upon the enemy.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +6 for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +6% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Tuskgor Chariots, and Razorgor Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Beastlord’s Spite
skillTree.description: The Beastlord truly has no mercy – those who flee will soon find all paths lead to a brutal end by arrow or axe.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +10% for Ungor Raiders and Centigors (Throwing Axes) units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +6% for Ungor Raiders and Centigors (Throwing Axes) units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +15% for Ungor Raiders and Centigors (Throwing Axes) units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +5% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for Ungor Raiders and Centigors (Throwing Axes) units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Ungor Raiders and Centigors (Throwing Axes) units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Beastlord's Lash
skillTree.description: No beast can truly be controlled, but these desperate contrivances bring the smallest semblance of order.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +6 for Chaos Warhounds, Razorgor Herd, and Harpies units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Chaos Warhounds, Razorgor Herd, and Harpies units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Chaos Warhounds, Razorgor Herd, and Harpies units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Chaos Warhounds, Razorgor Herd, and Harpies units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Chaos Warhounds, Razorgor Herd, and Harpies units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Hoofed Heavyweights
skillTree.description: These colossal, brutish warriors are the core of any true brayherd.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Minotaurs units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Freakish Mutations
skillTree.description: Mutations awarded by the Chaos Gods to their followers may look horrific to southerners, but such gifts are prized.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Call of Violence
skillTree.description: "We feel it. We all feel it. The pull to war. The tug of battle. The NEED to kill."

skillTree.name: Unrelenting Savagery
skillTree.description: The Beastman delights in constant fighting; in vicious, ceaseless brutality. It gives him purpose.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, and Bestigor Herd units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, and Bestigor Herd units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Ungor Spearmen Herd, Ungor Herd, Gor Herd, and Bestigor Herd units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Creatures of the Herd
skillTree.description: The Beastmen’s elite menagerie – the brayherds – slaughter all those caught in their savage, animalistic sights.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Razorgor Herd, Razorgor Chariot, Tuskgor Chariot, Chaos Warhounds, and Harpies units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Razorgor Herd, Razorgor Chariot, Tuskgor Chariot, Chaos Warhounds, and Harpies units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Centigors, Centigors (Great Weapons), Razorgor Herd, Razorgor Chariot, Tuskgor Chariot, Chaos Warhounds, and Harpies units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Bestial Butchers
skillTree.description: Only a select few from a herd gain their Beastlord's acknowledgement – a prize earned through the carnage and chaos they spread in battle.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 15% for Chaos Spawn, Minotaurs, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Chaos Spawn, Minotaurs, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Chaos Spawn, Minotaurs, Giant, Jabberslythe, and Ghorgon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Mage Hunter
skillTree.description: The stench of magic is palpable. No mage can stand in the midst of battle against the baying warherds.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +12% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes) and Cygor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Ungor Raiders, Centigors (Throwing Axes), and Cygor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Apocalyptic Vision
skillTree.description: In fitful dreams, he sees the end. The world collapsing in on itself, leaving nothing but ashes and aberration.

skillTree.name: Gargantuan Hooves
skillTree.description: The ground shakes. The earth moves. The spirit trembles. The Beastman comes.

skillTree.name: Feasting Upon Man
skillTree.description: For those who face the warherd, a fate worse than death awaits their salivating jaws and unremitting bloodlust.

skillTree.name: Blessed by Evil
skillTree.description: Unknowingly, the Beastmen serve their dark and Ruinous Gods, who in turn bless their every action.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +30%

skillTree.name: Foetid Gallipot
skillTree.description: A pungent mix of fell unguents ensures the unholy vitality of one’s minions.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Ruination
skillTree.description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

skillTree.name: Unholy Resilience
skillTree.description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.name: Corruption
skillTree.description: With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.

skillTree.name: Gathering of Beasts
skillTree.description: When the warherd gathers, there is much feasting, debauchery, and revelling in mania and depravity.

skillTree.name: Foul Premonitions
skillTree.description: Brought into this world by the cataclysm of Chaos, Beastmen are the very image of a dread future.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.name: Children of Chaos
skillTree.description: They bray beneath the weird, green moon, and do their perverse, grim butchery in the name of the heretical Gods.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.name: Crowfather
backgroundSkills.description: "Into the mud with them, break their skulls and eat their hearts!"

effects.description:
Movement range: +50% when using the Beast-Paths 
	(Lord's army)

Enemy casualty replenishment rate: -100%
	(enemy armies in local province)

Enemy leadership: -8
	(enemy armies in local province)

Attribute: Causes Fear for Harpies units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.name: Viletide [HIDDEN]
backgroundSkills.description: This spell calls to the creeping things of the undergrowth, sending a swarm of spiders, centipedes and slug-beetles onto the foe.

backgroundSkills.name: Flock of Doom
backgroundSkills.description: With a mighty bellow, the caster invokes Corvus the Crow Lord, summoning his servants to peck at the foe's eyes.

ui_effects.description: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

items.name: Icons of Vilification
items.description: These cursed items are all manner of blasphemy, from skulls of dead priests to hallowed, torn branches of Loren.
